body:
I don't like it either.
But given the fact that new interface methods added can only be done in new majors, there is no current fix for this.
I vote for more majors in quicker release cycles - that would solve this issue probably a bit better than currently.

By the way, why don't we allow people to change interfaces in minor releases? In my opinion, the compile error `Class X contains n abstract methods` is better than the runtime error `Call to undefined method X::foo()` though.

@skie Where ever the typehint was changed it's because methods were used on the argument which didn't exist on the interface. So if you were to pass an argument which only implemented the interface methods it wasn't going to work anyway.

Take `CounterCacheBehavior::_processAssociation()` for example. The method has a call to `$entity->extractOriginalChanged()`.  `EntityInterface` does not have a `extractOriginalChanged()` so typing the argument as `EntityInterface` was just wrong.
So I am not in favor of reverting that commit. The type hints should be reverted only after the methods used are actually added to the interfaces.

@chinpei215 We've historically not added new methods to interfaces in minor releases as it breaks existing code, as the existing implementation now causes fatal errors, which is not very backwards 'compatible'.
TLDR; We can't have a proper fix to this issue until 4.0.
So what's the big benefit for not waiting until 4.x aside avoiding a few ignorable phpstan errors?

I said  a similar thing in the past: https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9919#issuecomment-269415218
But now, we have already separated methods on interfaces into setter/getter. So now I think we should change the problematic interfaces, as compiler errors are better than runtime errors.

I don't think adding interface methods in minor releases will work out as well as some might think. To the application developer, their code is broken by those kinds of changes.

I agree that compiler errors are better than runtime errors. Perhaps we should continue using the deprecated interface methods until the interfaces can be updated? That would let us keep the typehints for interfaces while also avoiding runtime errors.

> Perhaps we should continue using the deprecated interface methods until the interfaces can be updated?

It would be a reasonable compromise. Perhaps, we should remove `@deprecate` annotation from the multi-mode methods, and re-add them in 3.6? Otherwise, people will see lots of strike-through in the source code when they open it with IDE. Fortunately, I am using vim though ðŸ˜› 

Since we would release 3.6 in near future, we might need not to remove `@deprecate` annotations this time, but for not near future, I think we should have a consensus what we should do when we want to deprecate methods on interfaces.
@ADmad potentially we have similar issue in https://github.com/UseMuffin/Webservice/blob/master/src/Model/Resource.php that also provides new Entity by implementing EntityTrait.
@skie Probably. Another way to tackle this is revert back to using interfaces for typehint and add ignores for those errors in phpstan.neon, though that would be technically incorrect.
